entry.title: Living in the middle of a big city? Your broadband may still be crap
entry.summary:
No cloud movies for you if you lose the postcode lottery

Living in a city centre is no guarantee of nimble broadband speeds in Blighty, as download rates are a postcode lottery.…

entry.title: IT Pro confession: How I helped in the BIGGEST DDoS OF ALL TIME
entry.summary:
Oh Trevor, how could you? Like this

Sysdamin blog  I contributed to the massive DDOS attack against Spamhaus. What flowed through my network wasn't huge - it averaged 500Kbit/sec – but it contributed. This occurred because I made a simple configuration error when setting up a DNS server; it's fixed now, so let's do an autopsy.…

entry.title: Rackspace gobbles Exceptional Cloud Services for Redis smarts
entry.summary:
A little Redis to go with your MongoDB, sir?

Just a month after chowing down on MongoDB provider ObjectRocket Rackspace is announcing plans to devour another company, this time gobbling up a Redis hoster Exceptional Cloud Services.…

entry.title: BlackBerry results not as bad as they possibly could have been
entry.summary:
Not even time for a beer yet though, far less champagne

Year-end financial results from BlackBerry appear to show a company stemming the losses and slowly gaining ground, but with a very long climb ahead and no proof it's going to make it.…

entry.title: Boffins probe into moons - and associated rings - 'beyond snow line'

Saturn's rings have been knocking around the galaxy since around the time our Solar System was born, NASA's Cassini spacecraft has shown. Though not in ring form the whole time, obviously.…

entry.title: Man's 'I own half of Facebook' claim branded 'fabrication' by judge

A US judge has recommended that the lawsuit of Paul Ceglia, the New York wood-pellet salesman who claimed he owned half of Facebook, be thrown out because it's a pack of lies.…

Virtual hover armada storms beach in propaganda pic

entry.title: Paypal struggles free of VMware lock-in, goes with OpenStack
entry.summary:

entry.title: You know how your energy bills are SO much worse than they were?
entry.summary:
Green.gov: It was gas prices! <Cough>Actuallyitwasmainlyus

Analysis  The government's Department of Energy and Climate Change, with the current minister as mouthpiece, has just pushed out a report claiming that its green policies are saving us money now and will save us even more in coming decades. Can it be true? We can save the planet - or anyway reduce carbon emissions - and it not only costs nothing, but puts money in our pockets?…

So trying out Lenovo’s business-centric ThinkPad Tablet 2 seemed like it would be an easy transition.…

entry.title: US bill prohibits state use of tech linked to Chinese government

entry.title: Entire internet credits snapper for taking great pic while actually dead

entry.title: Chinese game addict MURDERS girlfriend after she leaves him

Creep steals her credit card to fund all-night game binge

A Chinese man with a gaming addiction has been convicted of murdering his girlfriend in a jealous rage and, after doing the deed, using her credit card to buy more time playing games.…

entry.title: Indonesia: e-commerce firms must have local domain
entry.summary:

Indonesia will effectively ban cross-border e-commerce and make it harder for foreign firms looking to invest in the country, by mandating that anyone wanting to sell goods online must register a local .ID domain.…
